p: Interestingly, the models consistently identified a strong negative association between A/H3N2 and concurrent B activity (Figure 3L, R). Each standard deviation (SD) increase in concurrent B activity was associated with a decreased OR of 0.44 [0.32, 0.60] ( P < 1e‐6 for all 3 models) for A/H3N2 activity during 2007‐2015; conversely, each SD increase in concurrent A/H3N2 activity was associated with a decreased OR of 0.75 [0.58, 0.97] ( P < .05 for all 3 models) for B activity during the same study period. In addition, this mutually negative association between A/H3N2 and B was evident in all cross‐validation tests (Figure 3L, R).
